content:
PropertyTabAttribute Class

Definition

Identifies the property tab or tabs to display for the specified class or classes.

In this Article

[System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.All)]
public class PropertyTabAttribute : Attribute

Remarks

The PropertyTabAttribute lets you add a new property page to a PropertyGrid control. The PropertyTabAttribute can add additional property tabs to expose property information other than a component's default set of properties.

Constructors

PropertyTabAttribute()

Initializes a new instance of the PropertyTabAttribute class.

public PropertyTabAttribute ();

Remarks

This is a default constructor that creates an uninitialized PropertyTabAttribute. This constructor can be used to derive from this attribute and specify multiple tab types by calling InitializeArrays.

PropertyTabAttribute(String)

Initializes a new instance of the PropertyTabAttribute class using the specified tab class name.

public PropertyTabAttribute (string tabClassName);
tabClassName
String

The assembly qualified name of the type of tab to create. For an example of this format convention, see stem.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName*.

PropertyTabAttribute(Type)

Initializes a new instance of the PropertyTabAttribute class using the specified type of tab.

public PropertyTabAttribute (Type tabClass);
tabClass
Type

The type of tab to create.

PropertyTabAttribute(String,PropertyTabScope)

Initializes a new instance of the PropertyTabAttribute class using the specified tab class name and tab scope.

public PropertyTabAttribute (string tabClassName, System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope tabScope);
tabClassName
String

The assembly qualified name of the type of tab to create. For an example of this format convention, see stem.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName*.

tabScope
PropertyTabScope

A PropertyTabScope that indicates the scope of this tab. If the scope is PropertyTabScope, it is shown only for components with the corresponding PropertyTabAttribute. If it is PropertyTabScope, it is shown for all components on the document.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

tabScope is not PropertyTabScope or PropertyTabScope.

PropertyTabAttribute(Type,PropertyTabScope)

Initializes a new instance of the PropertyTabAttribute class using the specified type of tab and tab scope.

public PropertyTabAttribute (Type tabClass, System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope tabScope);
tabClass
Type

The type of tab to create.

tabScope
PropertyTabScope

A PropertyTabScope that indicates the scope of this tab. If the scope is PropertyTabScope, it is shown only for components with the corresponding PropertyTabAttribute. If it is PropertyTabScope, it is shown for all components on the document.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

tabScope is not PropertyTabScope or PropertyTabScope.

Properties

TabClasses

Gets the types of tabs that this attribute uses.

public Type[] TabClasses { get; }
Value
Type[]

An array of types indicating the types of tabs that this attribute uses.

Exceptions
TypeLoadException

The types specified by the stem.ComponentModel.PropertyTabAttribute.TabClassNames* property could not be found.

Remarks

All specified types must be able to be assigned to a PropertyTab.

TabClassNames

Gets the names of the tab classes that this attribute uses.

protected string[] TabClassNames { get; }
Value
String[]

The names of the tab classes that this attribute uses.

TabScopes

Gets an array of tab scopes of each tab of this PropertyTabAttribute.

public System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope[] TabScopes { get; }
Value
PropertyTabScope[]

An array of PropertyTabScope objects that indicate the scopes of the tabs.

An object to compare to this instance, or null.

true if other refers to the same PropertyTabAttribute instance; otherwise, false.

GetHashCode()

Gets the hash code for this object.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

The hash code for the object the attribute belongs to.

InitializeArrays(String[],PropertyTabScope[])

Initializes the attribute using the specified names of tab classes and array of tab scopes.

protected void InitializeArrays (string[] tabClassNames, System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope[] tabScopes);
tabClassNames
String[]

An array of fully qualified type names of the types to create for tabs on the Properties window.

tabScopes
PropertyTabScope[]

The scope of each tab. If the scope is PropertyTabScope, it is shown only for components with the corresponding PropertyTabAttribute. If it is PropertyTabScope, it is shown for all components on the document.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

One or more of the values in tabScopes is not PropertyTabScope or PropertyTabScope.

-or-

The length of the tabClassNames and tabScopes arrays do not match.

-or-

tabClassNames or tabScopes is null.

Remarks

InitializeArrays provides a utility function that can be used to set the types of tab classes that this PropertyTabAttribute specifies.

InitializeArrays(Type[],PropertyTabScope[])

Initializes the attribute using the specified names of tab classes and array of tab scopes.

protected void InitializeArrays (Type[] tabClasses, System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope[] tabScopes);
tabClasses
Type[]

The types of tabs to create.

tabScopes
PropertyTabScope[]

The scope of each tab. If the scope is PropertyTabScope, it is shown only for components with the corresponding PropertyTabAttribute. If it is PropertyTabScope, it is shown for all components on the document.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

One or more of the values in tabScopes is not PropertyTabScope or PropertyTabScope.

-or-

The length of the tabClassNames and tabScopes arrays do not match.

-or-

tabClassNames or tabScopes is null.

Remarks

InitializeArrays provides a utility function that can be used to set the types of tab classes that this PropertyTabAttribute specifies.
